data.title: Mmm..sizzling rice soup!!
data.text: So I have been coming here since they opened and their family previously owned mandarin house, which I ate  there since the 1980's. We had the sizzling rice soup and hot braised chicken. It was spectacular as always, I drive about 35 minutes to eat dinner here and it is worth passing the other 100 chinese/asian restaurants. Nice family owned business

data.title: Don't let the name fool you
data.text: I haven't seen Sizzling Rice Soup on a menu in over 20 years.   I was so excite to order it.  It is made for 2 people or you can order it for a dinner.   It is a lot of soup.   My mom and I shared this as well as the Ming's Beef (this is a new item on the menu.  Both was excellent.   While we we there, 3 other tables ordered the soup.   It is a must try in my opinion.   Will return soon!

data.title: Good Food and Very Nice Dining Room
data.text: The food was average. The service was very good. The dining room was very nice. I've been here a few times and would certainly visit again.

data.title: Excellent.
data.text:
The best sauces.
Awesome hot-sour soup.
Love the Mongolian beef and the Mongolian Deluxe.
Very welcoming owners.

data.title: So Good!
data.text: We have lived 5 miles from this place since it opened and never ate there.  Now we will be regulars.  So different from most Asian options in St. Charles County.  Truly delicious.

data.title: Very good food!
data.text: Finally tried this restaurant and am happy that we did.  The food was wonderful and the wait staff was awesome.

data.title: Great Hidden Treasure
data.text:
Love this place!  The food is fantastic and the menu has a wide variety to choose from: Korean, Chinese, Japanese. 
The staff is super accommodating and friendly!  This is one of our all-time favorite places to go out and eat near home!!!

data.title: Authentic, Tasty, and Reasonably Priced
data.text: This authentic Korean restaurant is tucked away in the old part of O'Fallon but is easy to get to off of Highway 70. They nicely redecorated a worn-out storefront space and serve great food.  As a longtime St. Charles County restaurant who has traveled and eaten at more than a few Asian restaurants, I can say we are lucky to have such tasty (and reasonably priced) food in this area.  It is in the shopping center right next to the red caboose.

data.title: Amazing Food, Personable Service
data.text: Very interesting tasty Pad Thai, boiled dumplings, crab Rangoon, and walnut shrimp, and holiday bread pudding for dessert! The owners chatted with us for a bit, as they do every time we come in, and we have had many items on the menu on past trips, never a bad dish! The Bread pudding is only for Christmas time so get it before it is gone!

data.title: Best Chinese food in St Charles County!
data.text:
Vince's Asian Bistro is a little known gem of St Charles County!

It's located in a strip mall in O'Fallon just off north Main Street. Don't let the location or somewhat quirky name throw you. It is worth the trip. 

The restaurant offers sit down table service in a casual, but elegant setting. No buffets here...and that's a good thing! The owners lovingly prepare each dish from scratch. The egg rolls and chili wontons were the best we've ever had! The service is friendly and prompt. The prices are reasonable.

If you're looking for a Chinese restaurant where you can order off the menu and have something that's of a better quality than the chain restaurants, this is the place you.

data.title: Great Wedding Dinner celebration!
data.text:
We had learnt about Vince's Asian Bistro through Yelp and contacted Vince and his wife Anna to arrange our wedding dinner.  They were a delight to work with and we had a 10 course feast!  The courses were absolutely delicious and the presentation excellent.  Lots of fresh seafood, very authentic and all our guests, including ourselves, waddled out of the restaurant happily stuffed that evening.  
Don't let the exterior and location fool you.  If you are looking for top quality Chinese food, you can't go wrong here.
PS. Dishes shown here are likely not on the regular menu.  But don't hesitate to ask!

data.title: Always Excellent
data.text: Food always cooked to order. Always fresh and perfect. Not a buffet, sit down and enjoy. The best Asian cuisine in the area.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Delicious food and large quantity of it - great service - never crowded, hope this place stays in business

data.title: Don't be fooled by the vague name, this place is great!
data.text: We have lived near Vince's for a long time, and always avoided it because we were just a little unsure.  The shopping plaza it is a little bit older and the name was a little vague.  One day we gave it a try and I wish we had sooner!  We consistently have great meals and great service!  The owners (Vince and "Mrs. Vince", we call her) cook your food and take your orders.  They are so nice and friendly.  The atmosphere is always quiet and peaceful.  You can pretty much customize your order anyway you like, my husband always gets extra-extra spicy.

data.title: Such a treat
data.text: This was my second visit and I just love this.  I really like the owner and staff.  They are all so friendly and helpful.  We had the Kimchee which was four little bowls of pickled and fermented veggies.  Pickled cucumber, diakon radish, jicama, and traditional fermented cabbage.  They were delicious and fun.  We shared the crispy spicy beef, bibimbop, and I cannot remember the name of the other dish.  I really enjoyed all of them.  Bibimbop isn't something we really see often in the Troy area so for somewhere this close to Troy I think the so a heck of a job with authentic asian food.  I look forward to trying more dishes. The owner was so sweet she gave each of us a to go container of mango dessert.  Will definitely be back.

data.title: Excellent food and the owners are wonderful
data.text: My husband and I love to eat at Vince's.  We have never had a bad meal there and we eat there often.  The Mongolian beef is excellent but my favorite is the Vegetable Deluxe.  We always get the egg rolls which are wonderful.  The tea is tasty. Probably my favorite thing is the egg drop soup which is wonderful.  I never order it  at any other restaurant because it usually is slimy.  That is not the case here.  The broth is light and tasty, the vegetable are perfect.

data.title: NOT a Buffet, Gamsahabnida!!!
data.text:
After seeing almost every Chinese/ Asian Restaurant I ever went to in the St. Louis & St. Charles county areas mutate into a cheesy buffet, I was quite happy to walk into Vince's Bistro and have a seat at nice, clean table and have a quality meal. Do not let the strip mall exterior put you off - once you walk in, the owners have done their best to produce a soothing environment with warm gingery walls, and have taken pains to install drapes, blinds & frost the entry door.  No, it's not the rarified atmosphere of an elite Hong Kong Hotel, but it has its own charm. It definitely has remnants of another restaurant from another era, but having been part of that older era, I personally liked the mix of old & new.
Despite having been sat after a large party of 20 plus, we were served fairly quickly with beverages and placed an appetizer order of Crab Rangoon and Potstickers (anything dimsum-related gets my attention); sadly, they ran out of Potstickers, which I blame on the large party before us. We substituted Spring Rolls, which were definitely handmade, filled with shredded vegetables and bean threads, served quite hot in the rice paper wrapper. The Crab Rangoon was crispy, and the filling was the old-fashioned, classic savory combination of cream cheese and real crab. It compared so very well to the recent trend of the local Chinese restaurants substituting surimi crab and sweetening the cream cheese. Lesson to local delivery: No substitution for simple quality ingredients, my friends. 
Washing the appetizers down with cold Sapporo beer and the owner's blend of jasmine & oolong tea, served in comforting ribbed white tea cups completed a very satisfactory appetizer course. By the way, the owner has a right to be proud of that simple beverage - the tea was lovely copper hued infusion,  lightly brisk, astringent, bright and floral with a dry finish. Lipton it is not.

Entrees were shared, and the Bulgogi bento box was quite generous - not only do you get a bento box filled with house made cucumber pickle, radish pickle, kimchi, and whatever else the chef wants to give you as banchan ( Korean side dishes), you get a nice plate of the bulgogi on the side, a well-marinated, plate of beef, cut paper thin & seared at high heat or on a BBQ. it was prettily presented on a bed of fried rice noodles, the whiteness & texture of the noodles setting off the deep brown of the moist meat wafers. I was a little disappointed to not get lettuce leaves to wrap the morsels, but I made do with the iceberg lettuce tucked underneath the banchan as a garnish. Again, I blame the large party ahead of us. Shameful of them to eat all my lettuce - I am sure Bourdain would have a snarky comment, so I'll settle for a note to self: Always ask for lettuce when ordering Bulgogi. 
We were told that one selection, Jumbon soup noodle, would take too long to make, so, with the evil large party holding sway over the kitchen, we settled for a seafood Chow Fun - a wide flat noodle, similar to tagliatelle, stir fried with shrimp, scallops and mixed vegetables in a deep, darkly rich sauce with a touch of chili. A side bowl of rice for the table was also brought to round out the meal. The Chow Fun was a nicely substantial dish for a cool autumn evening, the sauce slowly became more complex as we ate into the dish, but sadly, the scallops were missing. I will make one comment about rice here: It was rice. You know, that glutinous, sticky, steamed & re-steamed unto death grain you get in any eatery in the bistate area. ( At times, I wonder if Calrose gives kickbacks..) - wouldn't it be great if some restaurant owner broke the mold and gave its humblest dish as much attention as its finest creations? There are hundreds of brands of appetizing Asian rice & American varieties of jasmines and basmatis that would really elevate the dishes served. 
That being said, service was good, obviously tested by said evil large party, but we were served our entrees in a timely manner, and the manager/owner certainly was very pleasant to speak with; it may have been a stressful night in the kitchen, but we felt nothing but relaxed and comfortably full from a kitchen who obviously takes pride in fresh food.

data.title: Try the Bento Box
data.text: This is our favorite Chinese/Asian restaurant in St. Charles county. The Bento Box with Mongolian beef is one of my favorite meals ever. It comes with some pickled veggies and other apps in the bento box and the Mongolian beef comes with white rice. It's a lot of food for the price. Every time we get it other patrons ask what it is and look like they wished they had ordered it too. The service is always friendly and know their stuff.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text:
My wife and I just ate there last night, and as usual the food was awesome.  When we visit O'Fallon and are in the mood for Chinese,  this is our choice.  Once again we were not disappointed.  We had the Hot & Sour soup for 2 (more like 4) - Yummy.  We also shared a plate of Mo Shu chicken.  Anna recommended an Australian Cab whig was also great.

Believe it or not, the bill was $37 - yes with the bottle of wine.

Keep up the good work Vince - We will be back

data.title: Delicious Asian Recipes from the old Mandarin House
data.text: Great, tasty asian food.  NOT fancy place, but delicious food and very friendly service.  For those of you who used to travel to the Mandarin House on Page near I-170, the owner used to be the owner of the Mandarin House, and he brought all his recipes!  It lacks the huge lazy susans and fancier decor, but the food is the FLAVOR we remember.   Tonight, when my brother mentioned that he had brought me and implied that now I will bring my large family (I will), the owner brought out desserts for us to taste on him.  :-)   WONDERFUL mango pudding...and a decadent chocolate cake.   I had the mu shu pork...great plum sauce and  generous servings of pork.   There was plenty of food to eat tonight and take home a box for tomorrow.   Family enjoyed the Mandarin Beef, Kung Pao chicken, and they made up a Happy Family (even though it wasn't on the menu).  We loved the crab rangoon and the sizzling rice soup.   I will definitely drive my family in from Chesterfield!
